newsitem.title: USA: Dominion sees 97 reserve for competition costs.
newsitem.headline: Dominion sees 97 reserve for competition costs.

text.p: Dominion Resources Inc said Friday that its financial results for the remainder of 1997 are expected to reflect a reserve for potential costs related to the transition to competition for electric service in Virginia.
The company said sales of electricity to residential customers -- the utility's largest single source of revenue -- dropped 11.8 percent in the first quarter of 1997 from the same period in 1996.
This decline, the company said, was partially offset through the addition of 30,200 new retail customers last year.
The amount of the reserve the company expects for 1997 will be based on earnings in excess of the company's 11.4 percent allowed return applicable to Virginia sales.
The company declined to release its forcast of the reserve amount for 1997. Wall Street estimates the reserve will be between $50 to $75 million for 1997, a company spokesman said.
Earlier, the company announced earnings for the first quarter of $0.93 per share, up $0.06 or seven percent from operating earnings of $0.87 per share in the first quarter of 1996.
